references.reason: This book is a foundational text in causal inference, providing a comprehensive overview of the field and establishing many of the key concepts and algorithms used in this paper.
This paper introduces the use of causal diagrams for representing causal relationships, a key component in the methods described in this paper.

references.paper_title: Identifiability in causal Bayesian networks: A sound and complete algorithm
references.reason: This paper presents a complete algorithm for identifying causal effects in Bayesian networks, which is a significant advancement in the field and forms the basis for several techniques discussed here.

references.paper_title: Identification of joint interventional distributions in recursive semi-Markovian causal models
references.reason: This paper introduces a crucial algorithm (ID algorithm) for identifying causal effects, and is directly used as a core procedure in the proposed method.
This paper is seminal for the use of graph-theoretic methods in causal inference, making it an essential foundation for the work presented.
